SENT.plain: A 38-year-old man was hospitalized complaining of an episode of syncope

He was diagnosed with acute infective endocarditis (IE) of the aortic and the mitral valves with mobile and large vegetations, complicated with mycotic cerebral emboli related to the left anterior and the middle cerebral arteries
Double valve replacement with mechanical prosthesis was performed within 24 hours after cerebral accident occurred
On the 36 postoperative day, emergency cerebrovascular surgery was done due to rupture of a mycotic intracranial aneurysm
He was discharged on foot without any neurological abnormal finding
The optimum treatment of IE complicated with cerebral embolism is a controversial theme
Management should be considered carefully in individual cases
